Description: Terracotta female figure. Fragment of chest and neck only. Wearing a dress with a low cut squared neck, a beaded collar with centre disc and three pendant triangles, a ball bead necklace with central pendant and drop-loop earring. Mould-made and hollow with applied decoration. Traces of black paint (?). Light orange-brown fabric, somewhat porous, some lime and some fine mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels from both the Arsos and Achna workshops dated to the late 7th and the beginning of the 6th century BC (Karageorghis 1999, 221-4; Type VII(i and ii)). Karageorghis, J. 1999. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. VB. The Cypro-Archaic Period small female figurines. Nicosia, University of Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.009) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5835 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
